examples: He heard an insistent voice calling his name.
To some extent such insistent emphasis hammers the argument home, rather than inviting the reader to engage with it.
We are insistent on the National Unity Government to acknowledge Rohingya as an ethnic nationality group, and assure rights under the federal union.

However, if the CPU guessed wrong, it has to discard all its speculative results and perform a pipeline flush - sort of like when you miss a turn and have to do a u-turn to get back on route, and stop your GPS’s insistent shouting.
It does ask you if you want to upgrade, but it just feels less insistent, less, you know, making you second guess yourself essentially. -
words.defineEn: repetitive and persistent
words.defineVi: lặp đi lặp lại và liên tục

examples: I ask the questions, so I’m the detached voice, but only the deponent is in the screen.
words.defineEn: a person who testifies or gives a deposition
words.defineVi: một người làm chứng hoặc đưa ra một lời khai

words.defineEn: radiating or as if radiating light
words.defineVi: tỏa ra hoặc như thể tỏa ra ánh sáng

examples: Their bright iridescent surfaces sparkle and shine in stunning blues and purples.
And then it would just look like an oil slick of iridescent scuzz on top of the ocean.
Or two, the predators had a harder time seeing the iridescent beetles, because they were better camouflaged.
There aren’t any iridescent forests for beetles to blend into, but there are lots of shiny leaves.
And now we're just gonna bind all this up with some iridescent ribbon.
words.defineEn: varying in color when seen in different lights or from different angles
words.defineVi: thay đổi màu sắc khi được nhìn thấy trong các ánh sáng khác nhau hoặc từ các góc độ khác nhau

examples: Both men wore confident smiles.
She felt confident and beautiful in her new swimsuit.
I'm confident that the new restaurant will go like a bomb and become a popular dining destination.
And nothing was so irritating as the confident way he used archaic idiom.
During the chess tournament, Jane was confident in her skills, but her opponent ended up cleaning her clock with a series of surprising moves.
words.defineEn: being certain about our plans, abilities, the future, etc. and believing that we can gain success
words.defineVi: chắc chắn về kế hoạch, khả năng, tương lai của mình, v.v. và tin rằng chúng ta có thể đạt được thành công

words.defineEn: acutely insightful and wise
words.defineVi: sâu sắc và khôn ngoan

examples: The local factory produces electronic components.
The project's success will rely on getting the meat and potatoes right, ensuring the core components are solid.
The components play a big part in the cost.
These components make every household’s dust a unique blend of bits from its particular inhabitants.
It has four components.
words.defineEn: an element or part that creates a larger whole when with the other elements or parts
words.defineVi: một yếu tố hoặc bộ phận tạo ra một tổng thể lớn hơn khi cùng với các yếu tố hoặc bộ phận khác

words.defineEn: having or displaying enthusiasm, happiness, and liveliness
words.defineVi: có hoặc thể hiện sự nhiệt tình, hạnh phúc và sống động

words.defineEn: ill-tempered and ready to start an argument or fight
words.defineVi: nóng tính và sẵn sàng bắt đầu một cuộc tranh cãi hoặc chiến đấu

examples: A lot of times a bird will, um, be really reticent to move their feet in a different direction.
Some Europeans were reticent to discipline other Europeans with the same harsh punishments that Africans received.
Some Europeans were reticent to discipline other Europeans with the same harsh punishments that Africans received.
He didn’t want the guy to be embarrassed, and so he was kind of reticent to do what he knew that he had to do.
So if they're suffering from it, they'll be reticent to move around.
words.defineEn: reluctant to draw attention to yourself
words.defineVi: miễn cưỡng thu hút sự chú ý về mình

words.defineEn: quickly and effortlessly noticing things and understanding them
words.defineVi: nhanh chóng và dễ dàng nhận thấy mọi thứ và hiểu chúng

examples: A lot of what I did at Facebook as one of the older people in most of the rooms I was in was try to hearken back to the news and to the media environment of the ’60s, ’70s, ’80s that I was growing up in and really trying to bring forth that understanding that historically, news has had a special role that in some ways offset some of the more prurient and other sides of media.
words.defineEn: characterized by lust
words.defineVi: đặc trưng bởi ham muốn

examples: Don't be bashful.
He goes, then he's all bashful.
words.defineEn: self-consciously timid
words.defineVi: tự giác rụt rè

examples: The apple orchard typically yields a bountiful harvest each year.
The farmer harvested a bountiful crop of watermelons from his fields.
We had a bountiful harvest of wonderberries this year.
She admired the vibrant red flowers of the runner bean plant in her backyard, anticipating a bountiful harvest.
My grandparents planted Brussels sprouts in their backyard garden, hoping to enjoy a bountiful harvest in the fall.
words.defineEn: producing in abundance
words.defineVi: sản xuất dồi dào

words.defineEn: intermittently stopping and starting
words.defineVi: dừng và khởi động liên tục

examples: (R&B music) - R&B actually makes me wistful.
And they were a little wistful, because Cantor wasn’t the worst person you could imagine on the Republican Party on immigration.
words.defineEn: showing pensive sadness
words.defineVi: thể hiện sự trầm ngâm buồn bã

words.defineEn: after the expected or usual time; delayed
words.defineVi: sau thời gian dự kiến hoặc thông thường; trì hoãn

examples: And I would see, sometimes, I would tweet something, and then she would come back with an even pithier reply, you know?
words.defineEn: concise and full of meaning
words.defineVi: ngắn gọn và đầy đủ ý nghĩa

examples: Which was just the ticket for observing this sprightly young galaxy.
words.defineEn: full of spirit and vitality
words.defineVi: tràn đầy tinh thần và sức sống

examples: The bread flour helped the dough rise beautifully, resulting in a loaf with a lofty height.
So, she is certainly taking lofty challenges.
A loftier solution is to completely separate a study’s publishability from its results.
Instead of lofty love stories, her characters act naturally, and often awkwardly.
All of that experience led him to a lofty goal, to become the next big EV player in the industry.
words.defineEn: (of a mountain, building, etc.) very tall and outstanding
words.defineVi: (của một ngọn núi, tòa nhà, v.v.) rất cao và nổi bật
